title: U.S. Mortgage Rates Fall Below 6% for First Time in Years
summary: The evidence is patchy on whether lower rates have meaningfully spurred more activity, as the Trump administration floats measures it says will make housing more affordable.

title: Immigration Agents Arrest Student Inside Columbia Building, School Says
summary: Claire Shipman, the university’s acting president, said that the federal officials had misrepresented themselves to gain access.

title: New A.C.A. Plans Could Increase Family Deductibles to $31,000
summary: The Trump administration is proposing Obamacare plans that it says will lower health insurance premiums. But critics warn they would make care unaffordable.

title: Deposition Is Paused After Republican Leaks a Photo of Clinton Testifying
summary: Hillary Clinton had demanded a public hearing, which Republicans rejected. She is protesting that if a member is leaking to the press, reporters should be let in.

title: How a Close Associate of Epstein’s Found Career Redemption in Japan
summary: Top Japanese officials are backing a tech and entrepreneurship initiative led by Joichi Ito, whose involvement with Jeffrey Epstein may endanger efforts to get the project off the ground.

title: World Economic Forum Chief Resigns Over Epstein Ties
summary: Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway, had maintained contact with the convicted sex offender.

title: U.S. and Iran Take Break in Nuclear Talks to Confer With Capitals
summary: Officials from the United States and Iran are holding high-stakes negotiations in Geneva.

title: For Trump, Military Strike in Iran Could Serve Symbolic Purpose
summary: Some officials in the Trump administration hope an attack would force Iran to give up its nuclear enrichment program. Others have doubts.

title: How Israelis Feel About Another Potential War With Iran
summary: The national mood is somewhere between anxiety, resignation and anticipation as President Trump considers whether to attack Iran.

title: Why Are So Many Teen Girls Still Tearing Their A.C.L.s?
summary: For years, ligament tears have been a crisis among young athletes — even though a few simple exercises can prevent them.

title: China Wants Germany in Its Corner. It’s Not That Easy.
summary: China’s play for U.S. allies has a problem: As Germany’s leader showed, Europe’s grievances with Beijing may run deeper than its frustration with Trump.

title: What We Know About the Gun Battle Off the Coast of Cuba
summary: Four armed Cubans aboard a Florida-based speedboat died in a gunfight with Cuban border troops on Wednesday, officials said.

title: Why Are So Many Democrats Running for California Governor?
summary: With California’s political machine on the wane, nobody has emerged as a clear front-runner. Democrats worry that nine of their candidates could split the vote and hand Republicans a win.

title: Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders’s Plan to Build a Prison in Arkansas Divides GOP
summary: Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders wants to build a huge, pricey prison to hold the inmates incarcerated under her tough-on-crime agenda, and she hopes to oust fellow Republicans on Tuesday to do it.

title: He Hopes to Turn the Island of Nevis Into a Libertarian Paradise, With Crypto
summary: A Bitcoin baron wants to build a libertarian paradise on the island of Nevis. Democracy is getting in the way.

title: When Chatbots Are Used to Plan Violence, Is There a Duty to Warn?
summary: People are revealing sensitive personal information to A.I. chatbots — including plans to commit violent acts.

title: A.I. Complicates Old Internet Privacy Risks
summary: Artificial intelligence is convenient and easy to use, but you should think about what you say to the chatbots.

title: Man Arrested in N.Y.C. Snowball Fight That Police Said Injured Officers
summary: The event, which began playfully, shifted in tone when the police appeared. Mayor Zohran Mamdani has said that the episode did not appear to be a crime, while other officials called for arrests.

title: Venezuela’s Capital, Laid Low by Misrule, Is Stirring Back to Life
summary: New restaurants are popping up in Caracas. Nightclubs are bursting at the seams. The streets are eerily safe — with big exceptions. Could a revival be on the horizon?

title: How Texas School Vouchers Could Make Child Care More Affordable
summary: Republicans have embraced vouchers, while Democrats have criticized them. But as thousands of preschool parents vie for the funds, the state program may help a progressive goal.

title: ‘Grease 2,’ the Giddy, Raunchy Flop That Brought Us Michelle Pfeiffer
summary: The highly anticipated 1982 sequel failed to meet expectations at the time but has since charmed an adoring following with its ambitions dance numbers and nonstop ear worms.

title: How A.I.-Generated Videos Are Distorting Your Child’s YouTube Feed
summary: Experts caution that low-quality, A.I.-generated videos on YouTube geared toward children often feature conflicting information, lack plot structure and can be cognitively overwhelming — all of which could affect young children’s development.

title: Z? Zo? Mam? Mayor Zohran Mamdani is a Man of Many Nicknames.
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani has been given a bevy of nicknames by New York City’s tabloid newspapers and political class. Which will stick?

title: The Trumpiest Trump We’ve Ever Beheld
summary: The president is becoming the very thing that destroyed the Democrats: a reality-denying machine.

title: The Economy Is a Feeling
summary: Today, we’re looking at how politicians are framing affordability.

title: Late Night Fixates on How Long Trump Spoke
summary: “This time, Trump spoke and everyone else fell asleep,” Jimmy Fallon said.

title: Israeli Intelligence Agent Charged in Smuggling Goods Into Gaza
summary: The indictment against an agent of the Shin Bet security agency added to a growing list of Israelis accused of exploiting their positions in the security forces to profit from the war in Gaza.

title: Sorry, SpaceX: It’s Getting Too Crowded Up There
summary: Elon Musk wants to launch a million satellites, but researchers say global warming is changing the upper atmosphere in ways that makes space junk linger.

title: Antarctica’s Mineral Riches Exposed as Climate Warms
summary: Mining is banned on the frozen continent. But new research suggests that could change as ice melts and land and valuable minerals are exposed.

title: A Japanese City Received 21 Gold Bars With Instructions: Fix Your Water Pipes
summary: An anonymous donation of $3.6 million worth of gold highlights frustration with Osaka’s aging waterworks. It will only finance repairs to a fraction of the pipes that need to be replaced.
